briefdescription.para: fill the initial configuration before initialize

detaileddescription.para:
this is mostly used so that retrieval tools can broadcast the input collections they are using Guarantee
basic Failures
tool dependent

briefdescription.para: use the initial configuration before initialize
set the object type to work on

detaileddescription.para:
this is called straight after the tool is created and before it is initialized. the primary reason for this function is to allow jet definitions to be used for either jets or fat jets.
type
the object type we work on
workingPoint
the name of the working point we are working on or the empty string if this is a sole working point or working points do not apply
Guarantee
strong Failures
unsupported object type this interface may change when I introduce multiple simultaneous working points

briefdescription.para: the processing step we are working on
a bit-map indicating which object types we use
a bit-map indicating which output types we will create
fill the source component of the EventData

detaileddescription.para:
This is meant to be implemented by the retrieval tools that perform the shallow copy to document what they do. All other tools can safely ignore this. Guarantee
basic Failures
out of memory II

briefdescription.para: extract whatever we need from the given configuration object

briefdescription.para: The interface class for all the tools constituting object definitions.
